intro: Cyrtochilum alboroseum, commonly known as the white rosy orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces pale pink to white petals and sepals, with a distinctive yellow唇 (labellum) that enhances its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil for optimal growth. Cyrtochilum alboroseum is valued in horticulture for its beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
